content.description:
Sit start the incredible flake. Laybacking and smearing at changing angles to a spicy topout make this one of the best lines on the peninsula. The physical crux is probably coming off the sit, but the mental crux is a lot higher!

 This climb was likely done as a stand-start toprope "back-in-day" and was probably given a 5.9+ grade. It is better if done as a boulder problem from the sit! It has been brought back to life.
content.protection: A TR anchor can be built with some large cams (A #4, #3, and #2 C4s fit well, but a #6 might be best). Bouldering this climb with some safety may require multiple pads and a good spotter. The high crux is F-in' high.

content.description: This is a striking 25' boulder (set of multiple boulders, really) sitting right on the trail. The mail boulder is two boulders: one propped on another forming an incredible flake. This boulder receives visitors, since it is a destination within the woods trail system and is indicated on their trail plan. There is a 45 degree face with a very hard line on it. There are some dirty slabs and then there is the Bear's Den Flake. There are other boulders in the area.
